attributes.action: Waive NMC PIN renewal fees and reimburse fees paid since the COVID-19 outbreak.
attributes.additional_details: Our front line NHS are making the ultimate sacrifice for the public and are not currently supplied with access to appropriate PPE as is recognised by the government. They’re superheroes who give up their time, their safety and their cuddles with their children to take care of those needing support during this outbreak. They are giving our loved ones a hand to hold in their last moments when we can’t. To ask our nurses to pay £120 at a time when they are already giving so much is unacceptable.
attributes.background: NHS staff are the core of the fight against COVID-19. Let’s waive the NMC fee renewals and reimburse those paid since the outbreak.

rejection.details:
The level of registrations fees are a matter for independent regulators such as the General Medical Council and Nursing and Midwifery Council, and not the Government or Parliament.

We have published a petition calling on the Government to reimburse health care professionals for professional registration fees, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307399

You could start a new petition calling on the Government to fund health regulators directly, so they do not need to charge a registration fee.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
